title: Who am I?: developing a self-concept
creator_contributor_role: Agency for Instructional Television, production company
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Self-respect
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Peer pressure
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Conflict of generations

Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Conflict of generations
description: An adolescent negro works part-time in a night-club as a dishwasher so that he can be near the musicians and foster his desire to play the saxophone. However, both his school and dishwashing suffers in his quest for recognition as a saxophonist. Raises issues surrounding work priorities, self concept and the expectations of parents, teachers and peers. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
